info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 03 at 9:40PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM MDT/1130 PM CDT/ FOR EASTERN KIT CARSON...NORTHERN WALLACE... SOUTHWESTERN THOMAS...NORTHWESTERN LOGAN AND SHERMAN COUNTIES... At 939 PM MDT/1039 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles north of Ruleton to 12 miles north of Wallace, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Goodland and Winona. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 0 and 41. Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 439 and 450. Highway 385 between mile markers 188 and 200. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
